questions.question_text: A customer's environment includes hosts that support IPv6-only. Several of these hosts must communicate with a public web server that has only IPv4 domain name resolution. Which solution should the customer use in this environment?

discussion.content: NAT64 is a mechanism for IPv4-to-IPv6 transition and IPv4-IPv6 coexistence. Together with DNS64, the primary purpose of NAT64 is to allow an IPv6-only client to initiate communications to an IPv4-only server.NAT64 can also be used for IPv4-only clients initiating communications with IPv6-only servers using static or manual bindings

choices.C: use 6to4 and a tunnel to translate the addresses
choices.A: utilize NAT64 to translate the addresses
choices.B: implement NAT44 at the edge of the customer network

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Removing the (presumably) misconfigured spanning-tree cost 4 command is the more elegant solution. Manually configuring Fa0/3 with cost of 5 will also achieve the desired result of having Gi0/2 interface becoming the root; but is a poorer design choice.

Selected Answer: AD
I would remove "spanning-tree cost 4" from fast ethernet. This will cause Fa0/3 to have the default higher cost of 19 and so Gi0/2 will be the preferred one.

questions.question_text: When expanding an existing Cisco SD-Access network, in addition to the control plane, which two device roles are needed to create an additional fabric site? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
C Dis correct

Selected Answer: CD
There are no leaf nodes in SD Access.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the fabric management plane in a Cisco SD-Access architecture?

choices.C: enable EID-to-RLOC mapping that is based on the BGP protocol
choices.A: create LISP-based ЕID for the end-to-end solution that is offered by SD-Access
choices.B: enable automation techniques for device deployments and configurations
choices.D: create an underlay network that is based on the IS-IS routing protocol

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer confirmed in Cisco white paper, Software-Defined Access Solution Design Guide page 11 of 112. "Management Plane – Cisco DNA Center: Cisco DNA Center is a foundational component of SD-Access, enabling automation of device deployments and configurations into the network to provide the speed and consistency required for operational efficiency."

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer with an employee ID: 1234:56:789 must design a WoL deployment for a client, and the design must ensure that the Windows PCs are responsive to the WoL magic packets with no delays when the server-side initiates the instruction. Which action must the engineer choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Spanning-tree PortFast is used on switch ports that connect to end devices like PCs to immediately transition the port to the forwarding state, bypassing the usual listening and learning states. This reduces the delay in forwarding traffic, which is crucial for WoL magic packets to reach the PCs promptly.

choices.C: Spanning-tree PortFast must be enabled on all interfaces where clients reside.
choices.B: WoL must be enabled on the networking card and disabled in the Windows PCs BIOS.
choices.A: IP-directed broadcast must be disabled on all interfaces where clients reside.
choices.D: IP forward protocol must be disabled on all interfaces where clients reside.
